newsitem.title: USA: API says U.S. crude stocks rose in week.
newsitem.headline: API says U.S. crude stocks rose in week.

text.p: U.S. crude oil stocks held in primary storage rose 6.42 million barrels in the week ended March 28 to 308.90 million barrels from 302.48 million in the prior week, the American Petroleum Institute (API) said Tuesday.
API said that crude stocks excluding PADD 5 (Petroleum Administration for Defense District) rose 1.38 million barrels in the week to 245.50 million barrels.
Distillate stocks fell 2.58 million barrels to 99.43 million barrels from 102.01 million the prior week.
API said PADD 1 distillate stocks fell 2.96 million barrels to 31.53 million barrels.
It said gasoline production fell 312,000 barrels in the week to 7.04 million bpd from 7.35 million in the prior week.
Gasoline stocks fell 335,000 barrels in the week to 198.21 million barrels from 198.55 million barrels.
Percent of stocks capacity rose to 93.6 percent from 92.7 percent.
API said reformulated gasoline stocks (RFG) rose 1.59 million barrels to 35.91 million barrels from 34.32 million barrels in the previous week.
API said crude runs to processing units rose to 14.29 million barrels from 14.08 million barrels.
Residual fuel stocks in the latest week rose to 39.86 million barrels from 39.63 million in the previous week.
Crude oil imports rose to 8.02 million barrels per day from 6.91 million, API said.
